MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? CountedLoop (Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? iterations, Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? init, Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? body);

.method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle CountedLoop(class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle iterations, class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle init, class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle body) cil managed
static member CountedLoop : Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle * Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle * Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle -> Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle

Docs.param: a non-null handle to return the number of iterations this loop should run. The handle's result type must be int. See above for other constraints.
optional initializer, providing the initial value of the loop variable. May be null, implying a default initial value. See above for other constraints.

body of the loop, which may not be null. It controls the loop parameters and result type in the standard case (see above for details). It must accept its own return type (if non-void) plus an int parameter (for the counter), and may accept any number of additional types. See above for other constraints.
Docs.summary: Constructs a loop that runs a given number of iterations.
Docs.returns: a method handle representing the loop.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? CountedLoop (Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? start, Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? end, Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? init, Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? body);

.method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle CountedLoop(class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle start, class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle end, class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle init, class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle body) cil managed
static member CountedLoop : Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle * Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle * Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle * Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle -> Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle

Docs.param: a non-null handle to return the start value of the loop counter, which must be int. See above for other constraints.
a non-null handle to return the end value of the loop counter (the loop will run to end-1). The result type must be int. See above for other constraints.
optional initializer, providing the initial value of the loop variable. May be null, implying a default initial value. See above for other constraints.

body of the loop, which may not be null. It controls the loop parameters and result type in the standard case (see above for details). It must accept its own return type (if non-void) plus an int parameter (for the counter), and may accept any number of additional types. See above for other constraints.
Docs.summary: Constructs a loop that counts over a range of numbers.
Docs.returns: a method handle representing the loop.

format.a: Java documentation for java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles.countedLoop(java.lang.invoke.MethodHandle, java.lang.invoke.MethodHandle, java.lang.invoke.MethodHandle, java.lang.invoke.MethodHandle).

body of the loop, which may not be null. It controls the loop parameters and result type. See above for other constraints.
condition for the loop, which may not be null. Its result type must be boolean. See above for other constraints.
Docs.summary: Constructs a do-while loop from an initializer, a body, and a predicate.
Docs.returns: a method handle implementing the while loop as described by the arguments.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? IteratedLoop (Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? iterator, Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? init, Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle? body);

.method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle IteratedLoop(class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle iterator, class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle init, class Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle body) cil managed
static member IteratedLoop : Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle * Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle * Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle -> Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle

Docs.param: an optional handle to return the iterator to start the loop. If non-null, the handle must return java.util.Iterator or a subtype. See above for other constraints.
optional initializer, providing the initial value of the loop variable. May be null, implying a default initial value. See above for other constraints.

body of the loop, which may not be null. It controls the loop parameters and result type in the standard case (see above for details). It must accept its own return type (if non-void) plus a T parameter (for the iterated values), and may accept any number of additional types. See above for other constraints.
Docs.summary: Constructs a loop that ranges over the values produced by an Iterator<T>.
Docs.returns: a method handle embodying the iteration loop functionality.

Docs.param: an array of arrays (4-tuples) of MethodHandles adhering to the rules described above.

static member WhileLoop : Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle * Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle * Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle -> Java.Lang.Invoke.MethodHandle

Docs.param: optional initializer, providing the initial value of the loop variable. May be null, implying a default initial value. See above for other constraints.
condition for the loop, which may not be null. Its result type must be boolean. See above for other constraints.
body of the loop, which may not be null. It controls the loop parameters and result type. See above for other constraints.
Docs.summary: Constructs a while loop from an initializer, a body, and a predicate.
Docs.returns: a method handle implementing the while loop as described by the arguments.

Docs.param: the expected return type of the desired method handle
Docs.summary: Produces a constant method handle of the requested return type which returns the default value for that type every time it is invoked.
Docs.returns: a constant method handle that takes no arguments and returns the default value of the given type (or void, if the type is void)
